qas.question: Who was the son of Yazid?
When did Muawiya II's reign begin?
Who had the support of the Confederation of Qays?
In what year did the battle of Marj Rahit occur?
Who was recognized as caliph outside of Syria?
Who was a descendant of Marwan?
What year did the partisans of Marwan lose a battle?
What city did the partisans of Marwan lose a battle near?

context: Yazid died while the siege was still in progress, and the <b5_0>Umayyad army<b5_0/> returned to Damascus, leaving Ibn al-Zubayr in control of Mecca. Yazid's son <a0_0><b6_0>Muawiya II<b6_0/><a0_0/> (<a1_0>683<a1_0/>–84) initially succeeded him but seems to have never been recognized as caliph outside of Syria. Two factions developed within Syria: the Confederation of Qays, who supported <a2_0>Ibn al-Zubayr<a2_0/>, and the Quda'a, who supported Marwan, a descendant of <a3_0><b7_0>Umayya via Wa'il ibn Umayyah<b7_0/><a3_0/>. The partisans of Marwan triumphed at a battle at Marj Rahit, near <b9_0>Damascus<b9_0/>, in <a4_0><b8_0>684<b8_0/><a4_0/>, and Marwan became caliph shortly thereafter.
